citation.article-title: Taxonomic study of the Lactobacillus acidophilus group, with recognition of Lactobacillus gallinarum sp. nov. and Lactobacillus johnsonii sp. nov. and synonymy of Lactobacillus acidophilus group A3 (Johnson et al. 1980) with the type strain of Lactobacillus amylovorus (Nakamura 1981).

p.s: Description of Lactobacilius johnsonii sp. nov.
Lactobacilius johnsonii (john.so'ni.i. M.L. gen. n. johnsonii of Johnson; named for J. L. Johnson, an American microbiologist)
The following biochemical properties are different from those of L. gallinarum: acid from trehalose, melibiose, rafinose, and dextrin is G+C content of DNAs is 32.7 to 34.8 mol%.
Isolated from human blood and feces of chicken, mice, calf, and pig.
